alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clay; South Central Duval; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clay and south central Duval Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ortega, or near Orange Park, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orange Park, Cecil Field, Nas Jax, Doctors Inlet, Ortega, Lakeside, Normandy, Oakleaf Plantation, Bellair-Meadowbrook Terrace and Jacksonville Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clay; South Central Duval; Western Clay; Western Duval
